benchmark_details.name: ProteinLMBench
benchmark_details.overview: ProteinLMBench is the first benchmark dataset consisting of 944 manually verified multiple-choice questions for assessing the protein understanding capabilities of LLMs. It incorporates protein-related details and sequences in multiple languages, establishing a new standard for evaluating LLMs’ abilities in protein comprehension.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To rigorously evaluate the LLMs’ proficiency to comprehend protein sequences.

data.source: Manually verified multiple-choice questions from various protein-related topics.
data.annotation: Manually verified and annotated for clarity and correctness.

methodology.calculation: Accuracy is calculated based on the proportion of correctly answered questions.
methodology.interpretation: A higher accuracy score indicates better comprehension of protein sequences by LLMs.
methodology.baseline_results: InternLM2-7B model achieved an accuracy of 62.18% on the benchmark.
methodology.validation: Questions were validated through a two-round verification process involving human annotators.
